caption.p: Regression line of Log Infected individuals 7th April, 2020 on Log Density inhabitants/km 2 2019, considering the groups of cities with days exceeding limits set for PM 10 or ozone <, or ≥100 days.

Note: This result reveals that transmission dynamics of COVID-19 is due to two mechanisms given by: human-to-human transmission (based on density of population) and air pollution-to-human transmission (airborne viral infectivity); in particular, in polluting cities, the accelerated diffusion of viral infectivity is also due to mechanism of air pollution-to-human transmission that may have a stronger effect than human-to-human transmission!
